description: a(n) = number of (s(0), s(1), ..., s(n)) such that every s(i) is an integer, s(0) = 0 = s(n), |s(i) - s(i-1)| = 1 for i = 1,2,3; |s(i) - s(i-1)| <= 1 for i >= 4. Also a(n) = T(n,n), where T is the array defined in A026082.
comments: Third differences of the central trinomial numbers (A002426). - _T. D. Noe_, Mar 16 2005
crossrefs: Equals 2 * A024998(n-1). First differences of A024997.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
